page.title: 06THORNHILL THE CAMP SITE
page.content: There has been a camp site here for more than 200 years,originally used by tinkers (gypsies).Today people come by car,bike or walking.They have caravans tents or motor caravans and stay at the campsite while they visit the surrounding area.Facilities include hot water,showers,shaving points and a washing and drying area.The site has a licence from Stirling District Council.It is busiest during the summer holidays,especiallly in August. The campers come from many different countries;most from England, but many from Germany,France and Holland.Every year approximately 900 people stay at the campsite.On average they stay three nights.The charges in 1985 are Â£1 per adult,50pfor children,per night.
